No Principles:
The term "acid" is often used as a slang term for the drug lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD). LSD is a powerful hallucinogenic drug, and it is made from lysergic acid, which is found naturally in a fungus that grows on grains. The diethylamide portion of the molecule is added in the laboratory to make LSD.

It is important to note that LSD is an illegal drug in many countries, and it can be extremely dangerous. It can cause serious psychological effects, and it is not uncommon for users to experience hallucinations, delusions, and other disturbing psychological symptoms. LSD can also be unpredictable, and it is difficult to know how an individual will react to the drug.

If you have any concerns about LSD or other drugs, it is important to speak with a healthcare professional. They can provide you with accurate information and help you make informed decisions about your health.
